net.jodah.lyra.retry

Class RetryPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jodah.lyra.retry.RetryPolicy

  • public class RetryPolicy
extends Object
    Policy that guides how retries and recovery are performed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RetryPolicy()
      Creates a RetryPolicy that always retries by default.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allowsRetries()
      Returns whether the policy allows any retries at all based on the configured maxRetries and maxDuration.
      Duration getMaxDuration() 
      int getMaxRetries() 
      Duration getMaxRetryInterval() 
      Duration getRetryInterval() 
      int getRetryIntervalMultiplier() 
      RetryPolicy withBackoff(Duration retryInterval, Duration maxRetryInterval)
      Sets the retryInterval to pause for, exponentially backing of to the maxRetryInterval multiplying successive intervals by a factor of 2.
      RetryPolicy withBackoff(Duration retryInterval, Duration maxRetryInterval, int retryIntervalMultiplier)
      Sets the retryInterval to pause for, exponentially backing of to the maxRetryInterval multiplying successive intervals by the retryIntervalMultiplier.
      RetryPolicy withMaxDuration(Duration maxDuration)
      Sets the max duration of the RetryPolicy.
      RetryPolicy withMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
      Sets the max retries to perform.
      RetryPolicy withRetryInterval(Duration retryInterval)
      Sets the retryInterval to pause for between retries.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RetryPolicy

        public RetryPolicy()
        Creates a RetryPolicy that always retries by default.

    • Method Detail

      • allowsRetries

        public boolean allowsRetries()
        Returns whether the policy allows any retries at all based on the configured maxRetries and maxDuration.

      • getMaxDuration

        public Duration getMaxDuration()

      • getMaxRetries

        public int getMaxRetries()

      • getMaxRetryInterval

        public Duration getMaxRetryInterval()

      • getRetryInterval

        public Duration getRetryInterval()

      • getRetryIntervalMultiplier

        public int getRetryIntervalMultiplier()

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(Duration retryInterval,
                      Duration maxRetryInterval)
        Sets the retryInterval to pause for, exponentially backing of to the maxRetryInterval multiplying successive intervals by a factor of 2.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if retryInterval or maxRetryInterval are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if retryInterval is <= 0, retryInterval is >= maxRetryInterval or the retryIntervalMultiplier is <= 1

      • withBackoff

        public RetryPolicy withBackoff(Duration retryInterval,
                      Duration maxRetryInterval,
                      int retryIntervalMultiplier)
        Sets the retryInterval to pause for, exponentially backing of to the maxRetryInterval multiplying successive intervals by the retryIntervalMultiplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if retryInterval or maxRetryInterval are null
        IllegalArgumentException - if retryInterval is <= 0, retryInterval is >= maxRetryInterval or the retryIntervalMultiplier is <= 1

      • withMaxDuration

        public RetryPolicy withMaxDuration(Duration maxDuration)
        Sets the max duration of the RetryPolicy. This is the max amount of time that retries will be performed within, including the max amount of time to wait for resources (connections/channels) to be recovered.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if maxDuration is null

      • withMaxRetries

        public RetryPolicy withMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Sets the max retries to perform. -1 indicates to always retry.

      • withRetryInterval

        public RetryPolicy withRetryInterval(Duration retryInterval)
        Sets the retryInterval to pause for between retries.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if retryInterval is null
        IllegalStateException - if backoff intervals have already been set via withBackoff(Duration, Duration) or withBackoff(Duration, Duration, int)
